intro: Elaphrium epinnatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved elaphrium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
